statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -3 \\ 4 \\ 0 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -6 \\ 5 \\ -4 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ 15 \\ -17 \\ 4 \\ 11 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 3 \\ -3 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -3 \\ 4 \\ 0 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -6 \\ 5 \\ -4 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ 15 \\ -17 \\ 4 \\ 11 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 3 \\ -3 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
